=================================
### Event Title
The completion of environmentally relevant microcosm exposures for the validation of environmental quality standards (EQS) for drugs used in aquaculture

### Tender Brief
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is seeking proposals for the development of environmentally relevant microcosm exposures to support the validation of environmental quality standards (EQS) for drugs used in aquaculture.

### Background
The current environmental quality standards (EQS) for aquaculture drugs in Canada were established using toxicity data from laboratory studies. However, there is a need to validate these standards using data from field studies in order to ensure that they are protective of the environment. This project aims to address this need by conducting microcosm exposures with different contamination profiles to simulate the effects of sediment contamination on commercially and environmentally relevant species.

### Contract Description
The successful contractor will be required to set up and operate long-term and intermittent exposures with different contamination profiles on American lobster, Rock crab, and Green sea-urchin. The contractor will also be responsible for securing access to the species listed above, including berried females for lobsters. The exposures will be conducted in a facility with recirculating seawater and hazardous chemicals will be approved for use.

### Objectives
The objectives of this project are to:

* Develop environmentally relevant microcosm exposures for the validation of EQS for aquaculture drugs
* Validate the current EQS for aquaculture drugs using data from field studies
* Develop a weight of evidence approach to support the validation of EQS
* Strengthen the relationship between toxicity and field data

### Deliverables
The successful contractor will be required to deliver the following:

* A report summarizing the results of the microcosm exposures
* A report on the validation of the current EQS for aquaculture drugs
* A final report on the weight of evidence approach used to support the validation of EQS.

### Closing Date
The tender closes on 2022-09-02 at 13:00:00.

### Evaluation Criteria
The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical merit
* Relevance to the objectives of the project
* Compliance with the requirements of the tender
* Price

### Contracting Entity
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO)
